seriesStmt.title: František Ignác Antonín Tůma: A thematic catalogue of his works

annot.p: da capo of the first 42 bars

titlePage.label: [wrapper]
titlePage.p: Messa della morte | a 4 voci | 2 violini | e | 2 Tromboni | in conc: | con | Rip:ni e clarini col | surdino ad lib:tum | Partes 36. | Requiem e Kyrie . | Del sg: Franceſco Tuma | Maestro di Cap:a di S: Maesta | Ces: L'Imp:ce Elis: Vedova | L'Anno 1742

annot.p: S solo (6), A solo (6), T solo (6), B solo (5), S coro (4), A coro (2x; 4, 3), T coro (4), B coro (4), cnto (3), fag (3), clno 1 (2), clno 2 (2), trb 1 (3), trb 2 (3) vl 1 (5), vl 2 (5), vlc (7), vlne (7), org (6), mdc (8)
vl 1 and 2 in the hand of Copyist A, remaining parts by Leysser

titlePage.label: [first wrapper]
titlePage.p: Dies iræ. | Partes 32. [crossed out with red pencil; to the right: 20.] | [in blue ink:] 59 Blätter

titlePage.label: [second wrapper]
titlePage.p: Domine Jesu Christe | [in pencil] NB Alto et Tenore Conc | Partes 34. [crossed out with red pencil; to the right: 19.] | [in blue ink:] 28 Blätter

titlePage.label: [third wrapper]
titlePage.p: Sanctus et Agnus | DEI. | Partes 36 [crossed out with red pencil; to the right: 22.] | [in blue ink:] 40 Blätter

physMedium.p:
three sets of parts in three wrappers:
(1) Sequentia: 20 parts, 28 x 23 cm, hand-ruled paper, 10 staves (10 mm)
(2) Offertorium: 22 parts, 28 x 23 cm, hand-ruled paper, 10 staves (10 mm)
(3) Sanctus, Benedictus, and Agnus Dei: 28 x 23 cm, hand-ruled paper, 10 staves (10 mm)

annot.p: Sequentia: S solo (5), A solo (5), T solo (6), B solo (5), S coro (4), A coro (4), T coro (4), B coro (4), cnto (4), fag (4), clno 1 (2), clno 2 (2), trb 1 (6), trb 2 (4), vl 1 (5), vl 2 (5), vlc (7), vlne (7), org (7), mdc (7)

Offertorium: A solo (4), T solo (2), S coro (2x; 2, 2), A coro (2x; 2, 2), T coro (2x; 2, 2), B coro (2x, 2, 2), cnto (2), fag (2), trb 1 (2), trb 2 (2), vl 1 (2x; 3, 3), vl 2 (2x; 3, 3), vlc (2), vlne (2), org (3), mdc (3)

Sanctus to Agnus Dei: S solo (4), A solo (4), T solo (4), B solo (4), S coro (3), A coro (3), T coro (3), B coro (3), cnto (2), fag (2), clno 1 (2), clno 2 (2), trb 1 (3), trb 2 (3), vl 1 (2x; 4, 4), vl 2 (2x; 4, 4), vlc (4), vlne (4), org (4), mdc (4)

These movements have been archived under a shelfmark with an Introitus and Kyrie by Georg Reutter the Younger. Thus, they have been attributed to the latter (see P. Norbert Hofer’s edition in Denkmäler der Tonkunst in Österreich, vol. 88 (1952), and his catalogue of Reutter’s works, no. 46/4).

titlePage.label: [wrapper]
titlePage.p: Messa | della morte | a | 4 voci concert: | Due Violini concerti: | Due Tromboni concerti: Due Clarini con Sordini Oblig: | Tympano con Sordini | Con | Organo e Violone | Del Signore Francesco Thuma | M: D. C. della Imperat: Elisabeth: vedova

annot.p: S solo and coro, A solo and coro, T solo and coro, B solo and coro, clno 1, clno 2, trb 1, trb 2, timp, vl 1, vl 2, vlne, and org

titlePage.label: [page 1]
titlePage.p: Messa | della morte | a | 4 voci concert: | Due Violini concerti: | Due Tromboni concerti: | Due Clarini, con Sordini=Oblig: | Tympano con Sordini | Con | Organo è Violone. | Del Signore Francesco Tuma | M: D. C. della Imperat: Elisabeth: vedovio.

physMedium.p: printed staff paper (C. A. KLEMM. | A. N° 4; 8 mm)

annot.p: from the collection of Otto Schmid
